Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(2) Summary

APIs are more than just technology; they are the digital nervous system of modern organizations. What an organization can do in the digital space is both enabled and constrained by the way that it manages its APIs. It is therefore important to have an API strategy that goes beyond the technical aspects of design and implementation, and that makes sure that the organization makes the most out of how it uses APIs. On the organizational side, teams must be enabled and encouraged to use APIs as they way in which they collaborate. On the business side, it is important to start thinking of value chains as being composed out of digital building blocks, and to clearly focus on conceiving and designing all value-generating activities as building blocks. An API strategy embracing all of these aspects makes sure that organizations get the most out of their digital investments.

Why APIs? Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(7) What is Digital Transformation?

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]


Why APIs? Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(8) Goal #1: Flexibility

  • Build new products and services out of existing building blocks
  • Contribute new capabilities as building blocks to the platform
  • Improve solution space by making all capabilities available for reuse


Why APIs? Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(9) Goal #2: Velocity

  • Reduce coordination overhead by making capabilities readily consumable
  • Avoid duplication of effort by always exposing capabilities for reuse
  • Reduce the time needed for digital building block management


Why APIs? Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(13) Lesson #1: Expand Your API Horizon

  • Public/Partner API: Establish and/or drive new value chains
  • Private API: Become better at changing value chains effectively


API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(15) Lesson #2: Plan for API Diversity

  • Different user groups need different APIs

API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(17) Lesson #3: Architect an Open Platform

  • APIs can be contributed from various environments
  • APIs can be published to various consumers/environments

(19) Lesson #4: What's an API's Value?

  • Describing the interface is necessary but not sufficient
  • APIs have to be readily consumable products


API Perspectives Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(21) Lesson #5: Platforms Produce Value

  • The true measure of success is how much value is being produced


API Landscape Value

API Landscape Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(23) Adding APIs is Easy

  • Teams build APIs when they build capabilities (API first)
  • APIs can be easily added to the platform with as much automation as possible


API Landscape Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(24) Finding APIs is Easy

  • API products are described and published to be easily findable
  • The platform provides descriptive and extensible metadata management (API labels)


API Landscape Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(25) Using APIs is Easy

  • API onboarding is part of the platform experience
  • APIs are described so that they can be easily consumed


API Landscape Value Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(26) Improving APIs is Easy

  • The platform monitors feedback and gathers feedback
  • Updating APIs is part of the normal management model

(28) Measuring Digital Progress



Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business

(29) How can APIs help the Business?

  • Balanced and holistic view of public/partner/private API strategy
  • Focusing on APIs as digital building blocks and their value
  • Encouraging and supporting teams to produce and consume APIs


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Creating an API Strategy that helps the Business
